results.title: Community health and you
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Health and Safety for You”
Talks about health in reference to our daily lives, eg water, and how we have to be careful and make sure water that reaches the community is clean and safe to consume. Also goes into general cleanliness in relation to sewerage and garbage to prevent disease entering our lives.

results.title: Communities keep clean
results.brief_description: Compares community cleaning to house cleaning and includes scenes of street cleaning, water purification, park upkeep, landfill projects and air apollution control. Emphasizes that community upkeep is a shared responsibility.

results.title: Communicating in a team
results.brief_description: This video is a guide as to how to communicate better in a team environment. The first recommended step is to accept the diversity of the modern workplace and the array of backgrounds of staff members. This means having patience and understanding that those from another cultural background may find it harder to absorb instructions. Tolerance is the key to successful team environments. The second recommended step is to participate in meetings, listen to each other and show interest, stay on track, and do not divert from the meeting’s main topic; be open to ideas, don’t jump in early and trounce others’ ideas. Lastly, ask your manager for feedback. Be specific and probe for precise ways in which to improve your performance.

results.title: Commonwealth Journey [Edited Version]
results.brief_description: A record of the 1959 Commonwealth Tour of the Duke of Edinburgh, compiled film coverage of India, Pakistan, Brunei, North Borneo, Hong Kong, the British Solomon Islands, the Gilbert and Ellice Islands, Christmas Island, the Bahamas and Bermuda.

results.title: Commonsense afoot!
results.brief_description: Opens with a newspaper summary of the accident rate. Deals with the rules for pedestrian traffic, both on the footpath and on the road; the use of school crossings; the correct way of alighting from cars, trains, and buses; the advisability of walking against the traffic on country roads.

results.title: Comedy greats: Peter Cooke & Dudley Moore
results.brief_description: This film is a collection of some of the infectious comic skits conceived and performed by Peter Cook and Dudley Moore that were to influence and inspire a generation of performers with their fresh and innovative style. Collected from their landmark 60’s TV show, “Not only but also”, this video samples some of the best, to include; Bo Dudley, The Leaping Nuns, Roger and Sir discussing ‘the opposite number and how Roger came to be’, the moving life story of acclaimed Finnish film star of the 30’s Bargo (aka Anna Nigma), Pete and Dud discussing how they’ve rejected a host of screen sirens from Betty Grable to Anna Magnani. Including many other skits, they particularly enjoy poking fun at the film industry and the art world in general. Their repartee and affection for each other is obvious, especially when together they employ a number of techniques to prevent themselves from laughing, including stuffing their mouths with food.

results.title: Comedies. 1st 20 years. Part 4: 1908-1912 (D.W. Griffith)
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith and American Mutoscope and Biograph Company
results.brief_description:
Compilation of silent comedy motion pictures directed by D.W. Griffith and restored from the Library of Congress paper prints.
Contents: Balked at the altar (1908)—Faithful (1910)—A Dash through the clouds (1912)
